slogan: Since 1987, there has been a compulsory test (ITV) in Spain to check that vehicles are safe to drive. With the goal of having an equivalent inspection in the real estate industry, Injurad was founded. Everyone should be able to purchase safely, regardless of the value of the property, so that you can enjoy this beautiful country with peace of mind.
reason_tittleinfo: Experts in the Spanish real estate market use their own methods without having to comply with any regulations or having to undergo any supervision. The lack of supervision of individual transactions means that properties with problems are being purchased, despite the involvement of experts during the purchase process. The number of these cases is high.
reason_tittleinfotit: The problems are almost always caused by:
reason_tittleinfotit2: Contracts with missing or misleading clauses
reason_tittleinfotit3: Incomplete or superficial purchase due diligence
reason_1a: An extremely high percentage of properties have
reason_1b: no “Property Passport” (PDI) or they have an invalid one.
reason_1c: This almost always has serious consequences, which sometimes only come to light years after the purchase.
reason_2b: There is no supervision of individual transactions.
reason_2c: This means that properties with problems are being purchased, despite the involvement of experts during the purchase process. This would never happen if buyers had been informed of the risks.
reason_3b: La desinformación es quizas la principal razon
reason_3c: de porqué aún se venden propiedades problematicas a pesar de que todo comprador declara que no las compraría si conocieran los riesgos.
reason_qansw1a: A Property Passport (Pasaporte del Inmueble – PDI) is the most important document when purchasing a property in Spain. A property with no passport will never be legal. Practice shows that only a guaranteed independent investigation of the Passport protects the buyer properly.
reason_qansw1b: Lo más IMPORTANTE en una compraventa es asegurarse si el PDI se ha consequido legalmente o es valido. Esta investigación solo pueden hacer profesionales especializados, que deben siguir protocoles claras para evitar interpretaciones libres cuales no son en el interes del comprador.
reason_qansw1c: More about the Real Estate Passport
reason_question2: Risks and limitations every buyer wants to avoid
reason_qansw2a: Having problems with the refund of the deposit
reason_qansw2b: Not being able to rebuild in case of major damage due to a fire, a storm, etc.
reason_qansw2c: No guaranteed insurance coverage despite paying premium
reason_qansw2d: Having to demolish the whole or part of the property
reason_qansw2e: Finding it difficult or impossible to sell the property in the future which means that your investment is locked up
reason_qansw2f: Having problems obtaining or extending permits (renovation, rental, etc.)
reason_qansw2g: Being fined for a renovation which was carried out without a permit
reason_question3: ¿ Como me afecta a mí, la falata de ética ?
reason_qansw3a: Existe un conflicto de interes entre el interes comercial de los asesores y el interes del comprador. Al exisitir tantas propiedades que no cumplen los requisitos legales el «custumbre» es no informar completo al comprador o dejar toda la responsabilidad al comprador. Esto ha resultado en tres pasos para comprar con máxima seguridad:
reason_qansw3c: Contratos de reserva y Opción de compra
how_stepinfo_descr1d1: Have you received the most important documentation?
announce2: Be sensible, don’t skimp on control.
how_stepinfo_descr2c: Send us the contract that you are proposed to sign and we will check.
info_title2: Purchasing your dream home in Spain involves investing a lot of money. Should there be risks involved? No!
info_pa: Purchasing your dream home in Spain involves investing a lot of money. Should there be any risks involved? No! To avoid this,
info_pc: make sure that you are in control of the purchase process yourself.
info_pd: Due to a lack of legal and town planning knowledge, it is difficult for buyers to really know whether the experts are doing an efficient job. Therefore, keep everything under control with the help of Injurad.
info_pg: Tener el control de la compra significa comprar conscientemente
pdisection_titlec: if you want to avoid risks
pdisection_p2: Hacer realidad tu casa de ensueño en España significa invertir dinero. ¿Correr riesgos? Más bien no. Todo comienza teniendo tú mismo el control, para poder hacer tu propio análisis y tomar una decisión consciente.
pdisection_p: Injurad helps you to be in control and to avoid any misinformation or disappointment. We have a high standard of requirements that must be strictly met by the experts. This marks us out from other experts:
contidion1_tittle: Our experts must carry put and sing an inspection report in compliance with our guidelines
contidion1: Our experts comply with Injurad’s rules and protocols. They will prepare a property report which covers town planning and legal matters, the IGP (General Property Inspection). This is signed by the experts to certify their commitment to the process. The IGP report is intended to provide you with clear information about the property and the next steps to be taken.
contidion2: Injurad does not just hire any expert. Experts are selected not only for their expertise but also for their professional backgrounds. In order to work with Injurad, it is essential that the experts’ backgrounds prove that they comply and accept the standards and values of our code of ethics.
contidion3_tittle: Our experts must adhere to our regulations
contidion3: Any inappropriate conduct or any conduct that violates our code of ethics and behaviour, including non‑compliance with our protocols, will be sanctioned in accordance with our internal regulations. All our experts must accept them. We also have an independent arbitration committee that will assess any conflicts if necessary and advise Injurad on the measures to be taken.
contidion4_tittle: Our experts need to comply with our assessment system
contidion4: One of our quality checks is to assess the reports. One in ten will be assessed, both in form and content. In this way, we verify whether the reports meet the quality standards, which is an effective measure so that the experts go the extra mile with each report.
contidion5_tittle: The experts sign our code of ethics
contidion5: Injurad is based and motivated by carefully defined values; independence, impartiality, security, compliance with the law, integrity and work ethic. All our experts must comply with our mandatory code of ethics, which you will benefit from.
contidion6_tittle: Our experts are part of the Injurad Knowledge Centre
contidion6: The laws in Spain are constantly changing. Thanks to our Knowledge Centre, our experts can find a suitable answer even for the most complicated cases. Because Injurad is fully committed to real estate transactions, this wealth of expertise provides you and the experts with enormous added value.
contidion7: Nuestra principal herramienta para defender compradores en caso de que un profesional no haya cumplido los protocolos y pautas dejando perjuicios al cliente. Un comité de arbitraje compuesto por particulares y profesionales evaluando para garantizar imparcialidad.
conclution1: Por el bajo costo INJURAD pone al alcance de cada comprador la posibilidad de optar por la maxima seguridad en una inversión tan importante.
conclution2: Crea una cuenta y solicita a tu abogado y arquitecto que te asesoren bajo las pautas de INJURAD o elige un profesional directamente de nuestra lista, en ella están los que ya han declarado estar de acuerdo con el sistema y sus protocolos.
how_tittleinfo: Have you received any documentation or contracts? Please send them to us and we will check them for you confidentially and impartially. No contact will be made with the seller or the sales representative.
how_flujo_3b: No te los dan todos o no los tienen. Alerta!
how_flujo_b7: Consulta profesional idoneo segun resultado IGP
how_flujo_b8: Devolución reserva o deposito al comprador
how_flujo_b13: Firmar ante notario Felicidades ya eres dueño!
how_stepinfo_descr1: Before signing any contract, it is important to find out whether the property has all the documentation in order. You will either receive a few documents or none at all. In any of these cases, you do not have to rule the property out, but be aware! Unfortunately, some documents may give you the impression that everything is in order, but it is not as simple as it looks.
how_stepinfo_descr1b: It is impossible to have certainty about the legal and town planning situation of the property based on the documents alone!
how_stepinfo_descr1d: Have you received the most important documentation?
how_stepinfo_descr1d2: Is it correct what they have told you?
how_stepinfo_descr1d3: Are you aware of what this documentation is for?
how_stepinfo_descr1d4: Do you have all the necessary documentation to sign a contract?
how_stepinfo_descr1e: Please send us all the documentation and we will check it for you.
how_stepinfo_descr1c: Send us the contract that you have been asked to sign and we will check it for you.
how_stepinfo_descr2: Signing a contract involves making a commitment.
how_stepinfo_descr3: Finally there is one reliable standard for purchase investigations: the IGP inspection. This inspection puts an end to the individual approach of experts which it is impossible for buyers to check and therefore run unnecessary risks.
how_stepinfo_descr2b: Does the contract include all the essential clauses that protect your interests?
how_stepinfo_descr2b2: Are there any clauses that could harm your interests without you knowing?
how_stepinfo_descr2b3: Is it a reservation contract or are they actually terms of a purchase contract that oblige you to purchase a property, even if it is a property with problems?
how_stepinfo_descr2b4: Are the resolutive conditions clear so that if the property is not in order, you will get a refund (deposit, reservation fee, etc.)?
passport_info: The «Property Passport» is the most important document when purchasing a property in Spain. Injurad uses the term «Property Passport» (Pasaporte del inmueble, PDI) because the name can vary across the autonomous regions. It is better to use this one term nationwide to avoid any misunderstandings and disappointment. Some documents have names that could be mistaken for a PDI but are NOT. Examples of these are housing permits, documents from the Land Registry or Cadastre. The «Property Passport» is a name for an official document from the local government.
how_stepinfo_descr3A: Finally there is one reliable standard for purchase investigations: the IGP inspection. This inspection puts an end to the individual approach of experts which it is impossible for buyers to check and therefore run unnecessary risks.
how_stepinfo_descr3B: The IGP inspection is the most important part to both assert the legality of the property and to obtain answers for the questions that buyers consider appropriate to ask:
how_stepinfo_descr3B1: Is the property legal? Can it be legalised? Or is it illegal?
how_stepinfo_descr3B2: Is there a risk of demolition?
how_stepinfo_descr3B3: Are there any risks of fines?
how_stepinfo_descr3B5: Can the property be rebuilt in the event of damage, for example, fire?
how_stepinfo_descr3B6: Is there insurance coverage in the event of fire, flood, etc.?
how_stepinfo_descr35: Ask for an IGP and Injurad will check the inspection to make sure it complies with the protocol that we have established with lawyers and architects.
validity_info1: It is very important that a property has a PDI as this investigates its validity. A purchaser cannot do this research themself as it is complex (see «Example»). They need to be conducted by specialised experts, starting with an architect specialised in town planning and a lawyer who is also an expert in this field but from a legal perspective. If you want to enjoy Spain with no stress, it would not be wise to try and save money on an independent inspection such as IGP, given the investment you are going to make.
validity_info2_3: may become invalid due to changes to the property
validity_info2_5: can be unlawfully obtained by concealing information
risk_tittleC: DO YOU RUN WITHOUT A (VALID) PROPERTY PASSPORT?
risk_info: A property with no PDI is more the rule than the exception in Spain. This does not mean that a property with either no PDI or an invalid one cannot have one. However, a property that cannot have a PDI will never be legal. This implies the following risks:
risk_1n: Difficult or impossible to sell in the future
risk_3infob: for the whole or part of the property
risk_4infob: part of the property so that it becomes legal, or to live with the illegal status.
risk_7infob: for renovation carried out without a permit.
cp_slogan: Despite friendly professionals, always keep in control. The only guarantee to enjoy this beautiful country without stress is to know exactly what you are purchasing
cp_nomber: Tips from Casa Propia, the community of owners and buyers.

work_zone_garantie_info1: This works two ways. As a client, you want to make sure that the expert is doing their job correctly before you pay. The expert also wants to be assured that the client will pay once the job has been completed.
work_zone_garantie_info2: To avoid delays and to offer certainty to both the client and the expert, we work with a secure payment system. You will pay via the trusted Injurad account which will then be used to pay the expert when the job is completed.
form_igp_info1: The IGP inspection was created with the collaboration of lawyers and architects from the Injurad's Knowledge Centre (Centro de Conocimiento Injurad or CCI). IGP stands for Inspección General de la Propiedad (General Property Inspection).
form_igp_info2: Based on the report, you can decide whether or not you wish to proceed with the purchase. Is the property in order? Are there any restrictions? Are there any extra costs for checking the property or making it legal? Do I have to accept the risks? By way of example, some of the questions that the IGP tries to answer are as follows:
form_igp_info2b: Is the property legal? Can it be made legal? Or is it illegal?
form_igp_info2c: Is there a risk of demolition??
form_igp_info2f: Can I rebuild the property in case of major damage?
form_igp_info2g: Am I insured against fire, water damage or other damage?
form_igp_tit2a: Who carries out the IGP inspection and control?
form_igp_tit2b: The architects and the lawyers who carry out the inspection in accordance with the IGP standards are independent and have no commercial relationship with Injurad. It is important that the property meets the requirements of the land-use planning regulations (plan de ordenación de territorio local), which are the planning regulations established by the town hall. This is why every IGP inspection always starts with the investigation carried out by an architect specialised in planning regulations (Part A, the 'planning report').
form_igp_tit3b: A lawyer then assesses the legal aspects by checking the legislation against the architect's report. This results in the generation of a legal report (part B, the 'legal report') in which you will also find conclusions and recommendations.
form_igp_t2: Do you need your own lawyer before the IGP takes place?
form_igp_t2b: Except for drawing up a reservation or an option contract (see «Contracts»), you do not have to spend money on a lawyer. You first need to know what you are purchasing and whether the property meets your requirements. If everything looks good, it is advisable to hire a lawyer to accompany you to the notary’s office. This is why an IGP inspection not only means maximum security, but also considerable savings because the lawyer will have everything clearly on paper which means that the cost will be less.
form_igp_t2b2: Even if you have previously signed a contract with a broker or a lawyer, it is advisable to have an IGP inspection before you sign and pay at the notary’s office. This will give you peace of mind and make sure that you are correctly informed. An IGP can be conducted in complete confidence, without any contact with the seller, the broker or the lawyer. The report, signed by the experts, can also be used as evidence in case it is necessary to terminate the agreement.
form_igp_info1b: Each IGP inspection offers a series of important conclusions and recommendations. This allows you to weigh up the risks yourself and decide whether you want to proceed with the purchase. The inspection report also makes the final phase up to the notary much clearer, as it allows you to find out whether everything is in order or what still needs to be done.
form_igp_tit4arcont: Injurad's inspectors (also lawyers and architects) check on behalf of the buyers whether the IGP inspection has been carried out in accordance with our rules and protocols.
form_igp_info3: Each IGP inspection contains conclusions and recommendations, which will allow you to keep control and weigh up the possible risks for yourself.
form_doc_info1: Always check the documents yourself with the help of Injurad
form_doc_info2: If you do not want to drive a car without the mandatory car inspection and/or the driver's license, then you also do not want a property without the essential documents. The risks are the same in both cases, but perhaps worse when talking about a property.
form_doc_info2b: The chance that a house might burn down is small. However, an insurance company has the right not to pay out or the town hall not to grant a permit to repair the damage or rebuild the property if necessary. Is that an acceptable risk for you or not?
form_igp_tittle2B: IGP results are shown in three colours:
form_igp_tittle2B1: The property is illegal and cannot be made legal. It will therefore have important limitations, so you will be able analyse the risks yourself.
form_igp_tittle2B2: here are issues that have yet to be resolved or investigated. The report will indicate which expert can help you.
form_igp_tittle2B3: The IGP shows no irregularities. Contact a lawyer to accompany you to the notary’s office.
form_igp_infot2P: With so many documents to hand, buyers can relatively easily be misled. It is very difficult to distinguish the documents that are really important from those which seem to be but are actually not. The person selling the property is not impartial and they are only interested in selling the property. This is why it is so important that you take control yourself with the help of Injurad.
form_igp_infot2Pb: You will receive a report signed by the lawyer who checked the documentation.
form_igp_infot3: When should you ask for the documentation to be checked?
form_igp_infot3P: The moment you agree on the price and the documentation has been handed over (at least the essential documents). Do not sign anything and do not pay anything without a proper contract (step 2).
form_doc_q1: When should you ask for the documentation to be checked?
form_doc_a12: First, there must be agreement on the price of the property, provided that everything is in order. It is not advisable to sign a contract or make a deposit before checking what documentation is available.
form_doc_q2: What if you do not receive any documentation?
form_doc_a21: This does not inspire confidence. If you do not receive any documentation and you are asked to sign a contract, beware. It is logical for a buyer to have the documentation available before signing, just as it is logical for a seller to provide you with all the necessary documentation to sell the property.
form_doc_a22: In case you do not receive any documentation, it is even more important to be in possession of a good contract. See “Contracts”.
form_doc_info2b2: It is commonly believed that a property is in order if it is registered in both the Spanish Cadastre and the Land Registry and if it has a housing permit. This is patently incorrect and the reason why homeowners get into trouble afterwards.
form_reserva_tit4cont: Thanks to the Knowledge Centre, Injurad has its own agreement model templates. However, Injurad is only concerned about checking that the contract is used correctly.
form_reserva_tit4cont2: You can ask your own lawyer to use our agreement model template. This must meet the conditions that have been set out (see 'Conditions'). You can also choose a professionals who have already gone through the application process. They are independent, are not part of Injurad, pay no commission or fee, but are willing to work under supervision and comply with our protocols. Injurad wants to be able to guarantee absolute discretion and independence and only carry out the supervision in the interest of the buyers.
form_reserva_tit4cont3: The cost for a contract drawn up by a lawyer including IVA and the Injurad inspection has been set at €425.92.
form_igp_tit4q1answ: Injurad works with clear values; independence, impartiality, security, compliance with the law, integrity and work ethic. All our experts must comply with our integrity code.
form_igp_tit4q2answ: Any practice or conduct that violates our policies, including the non‑compliance with our protocols, will be reviewed and sanctioned following our internal policies. These regulations must be accepted by all employees. In the case of any complaint about any expert, an independent arbitration committee will be called in to find a solution if necessary.
form_igp_tit4q3answ: Injurad checks whether the reports meet the protocols, rules and quality standards. This is also an effective measure for experts to maximise their performance with each report.
form_igp_tit4q4answ: The professionals provide a report in accordance with Injurad's rules and protocols. The experts' report on the property covers town planning and legal matters and is signed by both the lawyer and the architect to confirm their participation.
form_igp_tit4q5: Participation in the Injurad's Knowledge Centre, CCI (Centro de Conocimiento Injurad)
form_igp_tit4q5answ: The laws in Spain are constantly changing. Injurad is fully focused on the transaction and therefore we work with both an expert in town‑planning and an expert in legal matters. Thanks to the CCI, experts can find a suitable answer even for the most complicated cases and help update and further develop our service. Both buyers and professionals benefit from this common knowledge and experience.
form_igp_tit4q6answ: An in‑house course covers the necessary information to start working with Injurad. During the course, we will explain how the system works, what is expected from the inspection, what the integrity discussion entails, how to share information from the Knowledge Centre, etc.
form_igp_tit4tit: The experts who work with Injurad
form_igp_tit4cont: Our professionals are selected for their expertise as well as for their professional backgrounds. In order to work with Injurad, it is essential that the experts’ backgrounds reflect their professional integrity with regard to norms and values. These are part of our code of ethics, which must be accepted by all experts.
form_doc_tittle2: Ask the seller or their representative which of the following documents can be supplied:
form_doc_tittle2p: To ensure that a property meets all the legal requirements, all the documentation that we have listed below must be available. We have divided the documentation into two groups. To get started, ask for the essential documents.
form_doc_esp1: Registration at the Land Registry (Nota simple)
form_doc_esp5: Residential permit (Cédula de habitabilidad), depending on the autonomous region
form_doc_esp7: Electricity, water and gas certificates (Boletines de electricidad, agua y gas)
form_doc_bt: If all the essential documentation for a property is available, it does not mean that the property is legal. Likewise, if the documentation is not available, it does not mean that the property is illegal.
form_doc_b: but we are here to help
form_doc_info: Illegal properties can be registered in the Land Registry (Registro de la Propiedad). The Registry does not check whether properties are legal. Illegal properties can also be registered in the Spanish Cadastre, because tax is also levied on illegal buildings. Properties with an housing permit (licencia de ocupación) that does not comply with town planning regulations or legislation can still be illegal. Properties that do not have a building permit(licencia de obra) and were therefore built without a permit could still be legalised if they comply with the planning regulations. This is why it is so important to have the IGP inspection. There is a lot of money involved in the purchase of a property, so follow the three steps and have an IGP inspection carried out by experts.
form_doc_btbl: Requesting a check is very simple
form_doc_btbl2: Send us the documents you have been given, including the housing permit (not to be confused with the residential permit!). We will explain to you whether you have the essential documentation, what they mean and which documents you still need to request.
form_reserva_tittle2: ¿Que contiene los documentos de contrato de reserva?
form_reserva_tittle2b: You have received a contract. A well-written contract is essential.
form_reserva_info1: There are many types of contracts and this makes it confusing. Signing a contract is an important step that should not be underestimated, even if it concerns a «simple» reservation. The simpler the contract, the greater the chance that clauses will be missing. However, you should make sure that a more complex contract does not include clauses that conflict with your interests. Therefore, you have to be in control with the help of Injurad.
form_reserva_info1b: Many contracts have the sole purpose of binding the buyer and completing the sale. It is not easy, if not impossible, for a buyer to understand the legal jargon of the contracts. An incorrectly drafted contract can lead to:
form_reserva_info1t: Being unable to have your deposit refunded.
form_reserva_info1tinfo: For example, in cases when the property is not legal or when it does not meet with the town planning or your personal requirements.
form_reserva_info2t: Being forced into purchasing a property
form_reserva_info2tinfo: with restrictions or even an illegal property, without you being aware of this.
form_reserva_quest1: We check the contract against our guidelines and protocols. You will receive a report signed by a lawyer.
form_reserva_quest2: The contract specifies the terms agreed between you and the seller such as the price, the reservation amount, the description of the property, who the owner is, the length of the reservation, that the property meets the standards, whether the property is furnished or unfurnished, the completion date, whether anything needs to be replaced or repaired, who the deposit will be paid to, who must sign, etc. It is important that everything is in order legally, and that your reservation amount (deposit) can be refunded if the property does not meet the requirements or is found to be illegal.
form_reserva_quest4: Fill the form. You will receive an email with the instructions
form_igp_infot2: Why check a contract with Injurad?
form_reserva_info3t: Being unable to discuss any topics
form_reserva_info3tinfo: that have already been previously agreed
form_reserva_info4t: Accepting responsibility for fines or obligations
form_reserva_info4tinfo: which the seller is normally responsible for.
other: Control < 2 documentos y Control contrato: 459,8 € (incl. iva)
other2: Control > 2 documentos y Control contrato: 514,25 € (incl. iva)
form_reserva_info1pb: Why check a contract with Injurad?
About_tittle1: Glad we can contribute to the realization of your dream.
About_tittle1_info: Our goal is to ensure that everyone is able to purchase safely, regardless of the value of the property, and at a reasonable fee. You will be provided with clear and honest information regarding the status of the property.
About_tittle2: How do we achieve our goal?
About_tittle2_info1_1: This goal is only achieved by establishing a procedure with clear guidelines and rules for the experts, which allow them to exercise control over their work in the client’s best interests.
About_tittle2_info2_1: We highlight the difference between an independent expert, and an expert who follows protocols, who accepts our controls and who accepts our code of ethics and regulations.
About_tittle2_info3_1: The results of the inspection are presented in a report that is clear and easy to understand, signed by a professional who is an expert in that field, and which provides technical coverage to third parties.
About_tittle2_info4_1: We carry out a thorough evaluation of one in ten reports for quality assurance, with mutual checks and co-operation between the experts involved. We have an incident resolution procedure for complaints, and continuous improvement for the entire system. These are examples of the checks we conduct to ensure a high quality end result.
About_tittle2_info5_1: The collective experience and knowledge of the experts provides enormous added value when preparing an inspection, taking into account that the Spanish regulations in the field of land-use planning are applied differently depending on the autonomous region.
About_tittle3_info: The experts are specialised real estate professionals. They are architects who specialise in land-use planning and lawyers with extensive knowledge of the law related to land-use planning. The system is available to any expert. Experts who have already accepted Injurad’s guidelines and protocols are entered into our database so that a request can randomly be assigned to them. Any expert who is new to Injurad will have access to the system once the validation and training process is complete.
About_text1: Ralph and Luz have personally experienced the consequences of deception. Now they are committed to prevention, so that the Spanish dream of others can be realized. Listen to their story.Ralph y Luz han experimentado personalmente las consecuencias del engaño. Ahora apuestan por la prevención, para que el sueño de tener una casa sin problemas se cumpla para todos. Escucha su historia.
About_text2: Juan Navarro is a lawyer and co-founder of Injurad. He ensures that Injurad stays on track in terms of knowledge and ethics of the professionals who carry out checks and inspections on behalf of buyers.
About_tittle4_info: Injurad’s team consists of lawyers and architects who specialise in planning regulations. Their responsibility is to check reports against fixed guidelines and protocols.
About_tittle4_tittle1_info: Our architects who specialise in planning regulations verify that the IGP inspections comply with our protocols.
About_tittle4_tittle2_info: Lawyers who specialise in planning regulations are responsible for checking documents and contracts as well as checking that the IGP inspections comply with our guidelines and protocols.
About_tittle5: Los Abogados de injurad que tambien cuentan con la experiencia y el conocimiento en las leyes urbanísticas, para supervisar los procesos de inspección.
About_tittle6_info: In order to meet our objective, Injurad works nationally. To do this, the system takes into account both national laws and regional and local regulations.
mensaje_enviadotit: Thank you for your confidence in Injurad
